content.content:
Classify this document into exactly one of these categories:

letter  	[ A formal written correspondence with sender/recipient addresses, date, salutation, body, and closing signature ]
form  	[ A structured document with labeled fields, checkboxes, or blanks requiring user input and completion ]
invoice  	[ A billing document listing items/services, quantities, prices, payment terms, and transaction totals ]
resume  	[ A professional summary showcasing work experience, education, skills, and achievements for job applications ]
scientific_publication  	[ A peer-reviewed academic document with abstract, methodology, results, citations, and research findings ]
memo  	[ An internal business communication with TO/FROM/DATE/SUBJECT headers for organizational announcements or directives ]
advertisement  	[ A promotional material featuring product images, marketing text, calls-to-action, and branding elements ]
email  	[ A digital message with email headers (To/From/Subject), timestamps, and conversational threading ]
questionnaire  	[ A survey instrument containing numbered questions with multiple choice, rating scales, or open-ended responses ]
specification  	[ A technical document detailing precise requirements, measurements, standards, and implementation criteria ]
generic  	[ An unstructured document lacking distinctive formatting or purpose-specific elements of other categories ]

Respond only with a JSON object containing the class label. For example: {{"class": "letter"}}
<few_shot_examples>
This is an example of the class 'letter'
This is an example of the class 'letter'
This is an example of the class 'email'

</few_shot_examples>
<<CACHEPOINT>>
<document_ocr_data>
This is a sample document for testing classification.
</document_ocr_data>
